metadata.title: CVE-2019-20807 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In Vim before 8.1.0881, users can circumvent the rvim restricted mode andexecute arbitrary OS commands via scripting interfaces (e.g., Python, Ruby,or Lua).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm4').
